revised_title: High-Purity Iron Single Crystals: Strain Rate and Temperature Effects on Yield and Fracture Behavior
tldr: This study investigates the yield and fracture behavior of high-purity iron single crystals at high strain rates and various temperatures. The results show that increasing the strain rate leads to higher yield stress, a wider temperature range for twinning, and a more extensive region of brittle behavior. The research also provides evidence that cleavage fracture is always preceded by twinning.
